commit.message:
configure.in (*-ibm-aix4.[12]*): Delete test for gnu ld.

	* configure.in (*-ibm-aix4.[12]*): Delete test for gnu ld.  Always
	use t-aix41 when host == target.

From-SVN: r35747

files.patch:
@@ -1,3 +1,8 @@
+2000-08-16  Kaveh R. Ghazi  <ghazi@caip.rutgers.edu>
+
+	* configure.in (*-ibm-aix4.[12]*): Delete test for gnu ld.  Always
+	use t-aix41 when host == target.
+
 2000-08-16  Richard Henderson  <rth@cygnus.com>
 
 	* reload.c (push_secondary_reload): Revert last change.

@@ -1514,7 +1514,7 @@ esac
 
 
 # Find some useful tools
-for ac_prog in gawk mawk nawk awk
+for ac_prog in mawk gawk nawk awk
 do
 # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
@@ -6247,13 +6247,7 @@ for machine in $build $host $target; do
 		then
 			tmake_file=rs6000/t-xnewas
 		else
-			tmake_file=rs6000/t-newas
-		fi
-		if test "$gnu_ld" = yes
-		then
-			xmake_file=rs6000/x-aix41-gld
-		else
-			tmake_file="rs6000/t-newas rs6000/t-aix41"
+			tmake_file='rs6000/t-newas rs6000/t-aix41'
 		fi
 		xmake_file=rs6000/x-aix41
 		float_format=none
@@ -7106,15 +7100,15 @@ fi
 
 
         echo $ac_n "checking for strerror in -lcposix""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7110: checking for strerror in -lcposix" >&5
+echo "configure:7104: checking for strerror in -lcposix" >&5
 ac_lib_var=`echo cposix'_'strerror | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   ac_save_LIBS="$LIBS"
 LIBS="-lcposix  $LIBS"
 cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7118 "configure"
+#line 7112 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* Override any gcc2 internal prototype to avoid an error.  */
 /* We use char because int might match the return type of a gcc2
@@ -7125,7 +7119,7 @@ int main() {
 strerror()
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7129: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:7123: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var=yes"
 else
@@ -7148,12 +7142,12 @@ fi
   
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for working const""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7152: checking for working const" >&5
+echo "configure:7146: checking for working const" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_c_const'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7157 "configure"
+#line 7151 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 int main() {
@@ -7202,7 +7196,7 @@ ccp = (char const *const *) p;
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7206: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:7200: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_c_const=yes
 else
@@ -7223,12 +7217,12 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for off_t""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7227: checking for off_t" >&5
+echo "configure:7221: checking for off_t" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_type_off_t'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7232 "configure"
+#line 7226 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/types.h>
 #if STDC_HEADERS
@@ -7256,12 +7250,12 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for size_t""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7260: checking for size_t" >&5
+echo "configure:7254: checking for size_t" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_type_size_t'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7265 "configure"
+#line 7259 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/types.h>
 #if STDC_HEADERS
@@ -7291,19 +7285,19 @@ fi
 # The Ultrix 4.2 mips builtin alloca declared by alloca.h only works
 # for constant arguments.  Useless!
 echo $ac_n "checking for working alloca.h""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7295: checking for working alloca.h" >&5
+echo "configure:7289: checking for working alloca.h" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_alloca_h'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7300 "configure"
+#line 7294 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <alloca.h>
 int main() {
 char *p = alloca(2 * sizeof(int));
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7307: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:7301: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_header_alloca_h=yes
 else
@@ -7324,12 +7318,12 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for alloca""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7328: checking for alloca" >&5
+echo "configure:7322: checking for alloca" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_alloca_works'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7333 "configure"
+#line 7327 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 #ifdef __GNUC__
@@ -7357,7 +7351,7 @@ int main() {
 char *p = (char *) alloca(1);
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7361: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:7355: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_func_alloca_works=yes
 else
@@ -7389,12 +7383,12 @@ EOF
 
 
 echo $ac_n "checking whether alloca needs Cray hooks""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7393: checking whether alloca needs Cray hooks" >&5
+echo "configure:7387: checking whether alloca needs Cray hooks" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_os_cray'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7398 "configure"
+#line 7392 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #if defined(CRAY) && ! defined(CRAY2)
 webecray
@@ -7419,12 +7413,12 @@ echo "$ac_t""$ac_cv_os_cray" 1>&6
 if test $ac_cv_os_cray = yes; then
 for ac_func in _getb67 GETB67 getb67; do
   echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_func""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7423: checking for $ac_func" >&5
+echo "configure:7417: checking for $ac_func" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7428 "configure"
+#line 7422 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char $ac_func(); below.  */
@@ -7447,7 +7441,7 @@ $ac_func();
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7451: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:7445: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_$ac_func=yes"
 else
@@ -7474,15 +7468,15 @@ done
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking stack direction for C alloca""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7478: checking stack direction for C alloca" >&5
+echo "configure:7472: checking stack direction for C alloca" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_c_stack_direction'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   if test "$cross_compiling" = yes; then
   ac_cv_c_stack_direction=0
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7486 "configure"
+#line 7480 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 find_stack_direction ()
 {
@@ -7501,7 +7495,7 @@ main ()
   exit (find_stack_direction() < 0);
 }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7505: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
+if { (eval echo configure:7499: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
 then
   ac_cv_c_stack_direction=1
 else
@@ -7528,17 +7522,17 @@ unistd.h sys/param.h
 do
 ac_safe=`echo "$ac_hdr" | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_hdr""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7532: checking for $ac_hdr" >&5
+echo "configure:7526: checking for $ac_hdr" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_$ac_safe'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7537 "configure"
+#line 7531 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <$ac_hdr>
 EOF
 ac_try="$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext >/dev/null 2>conftest.out"
-{ (eval echo configure:7542: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
+{ (eval echo configure:7536: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
 ac_err=`grep -v '^ *+' conftest.out | grep -v "^conftest.${ac_ext}\$"`
 if test -z "$ac_err"; then
   rm -rf conftest*
@@ -7568,12 +7562,12 @@ done
 strdup __argz_count __argz_stringify __argz_next
 do
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_func""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7572: checking for $ac_func" >&5
+echo "configure:7566: checking for $ac_func" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7577 "configure"
+#line 7571 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char $ac_func(); below.  */
@@ -7596,7 +7590,7 @@ $ac_func();
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7600: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:7594: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_$ac_func=yes"
 else
@@ -7625,12 +7619,12 @@ done
      for ac_func in stpcpy
 do
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_func""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7629: checking for $ac_func" >&5
+echo "configure:7623: checking for $ac_func" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7634 "configure"
+#line 7628 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char $ac_func(); below.  */
@@ -7653,7 +7647,7 @@ $ac_func();
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7657: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:7651: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_$ac_func=yes"
 else
@@ -7687,19 +7681,19 @@ EOF
 
    if test $ac_cv_header_locale_h = yes; then
     echo $ac_n "checking for LC_MESSAGES""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7691: checking for LC_MESSAGES" >&5
+echo "configure:7685: checking for LC_MESSAGES" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'am_cv_val_LC_MESSAGES'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7696 "configure"
+#line 7690 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <locale.h>
 int main() {
 return LC_MESSAGES
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7703: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:7697: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   am_cv_val_LC_MESSAGES=yes
 else
@@ -7720,7 +7714,7 @@ EOF
     fi
   fi
    echo $ac_n "checking whether NLS is requested""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7724: checking whether NLS is requested" >&5
+echo "configure:7718: checking whether NLS is requested" >&5
         # Check whether --enable-nls or --disable-nls was given.
 if test "${enable_nls+set}" = set; then
   enableval="$enable_nls"
@@ -7740,7 +7734,7 @@ fi
 EOF
 
       echo $ac_n "checking whether included gettext is requested""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7744: checking whether included gettext is requested" >&5
+echo "configure:7738: checking whether included gettext is requested" >&5
       # Check whether --with-included-gettext or --without-included-gettext was given.
 if test "${with_included_gettext+set}" = set; then
   withval="$with_included_gettext"
@@ -7759,17 +7753,17 @@ fi
 
 	ac_safe=`echo "libintl.h" | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 echo $ac_n "checking for libintl.h""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7763: checking for libintl.h" >&5
+echo "configure:7757: checking for libintl.h" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_$ac_safe'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7768 "configure"
+#line 7762 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <libintl.h>
 EOF
 ac_try="$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext >/dev/null 2>conftest.out"
-{ (eval echo configure:7773: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
+{ (eval echo configure:7767: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
 ac_err=`grep -v '^ *+' conftest.out | grep -v "^conftest.${ac_ext}\$"`
 if test -z "$ac_err"; then
   rm -rf conftest*
@@ -7786,19 +7780,19 @@ fi
 if eval "test \"`echo '$ac_cv_header_'$ac_safe`\" = yes"; then
   echo "$ac_t""yes" 1>&6
   echo $ac_n "checking for gettext in libc""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7790: checking for gettext in libc" >&5
+echo "configure:7784: checking for gettext in libc" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gt_cv_func_gettext_libc'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7795 "configure"
+#line 7789 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <libintl.h>
 int main() {
 return (int) gettext ("")
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7802: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:7796: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   gt_cv_func_gettext_libc=yes
 else
@@ -7814,15 +7808,15 @@ echo "$ac_t""$gt_cv_func_gettext_libc" 1>&6
 
 	   if test "$gt_cv_func_gettext_libc" != "yes"; then
 	     echo $ac_n "checking for bindtextdomain in -lintl""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7818: checking for bindtextdomain in -lintl" >&5
+echo "configure:7812: checking for bindtextdomain in -lintl" >&5
 ac_lib_var=`echo intl'_'bindtextdomain | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   ac_save_LIBS="$LIBS"
 LIBS="-lintl  $LIBS"
 cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7826 "configure"
+#line 7820 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* Override any gcc2 internal prototype to avoid an error.  */
 /* We use char because int might match the return type of a gcc2
@@ -7833,7 +7827,7 @@ int main() {
 bindtextdomain()
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7837: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:7831: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var=yes"
 else
@@ -7849,20 +7843,20 @@ fi
 if eval "test \"`echo '$ac_cv_lib_'$ac_lib_var`\" = yes"; then
   echo "$ac_t""yes" 1>&6
   echo $ac_n "checking for gettext in libintl""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7853: checking for gettext in libintl" >&5
+echo "configure:7847: checking for gettext in libintl" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gt_cv_func_gettext_libintl'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   echo $ac_n "checking for gettext in -lintl""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7858: checking for gettext in -lintl" >&5
+echo "configure:7852: checking for gettext in -lintl" >&5
 ac_lib_var=`echo intl'_'gettext | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   ac_save_LIBS="$LIBS"
 LIBS="-lintl  $LIBS"
 cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7866 "configure"
+#line 7860 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* Override any gcc2 internal prototype to avoid an error.  */
 /* We use char because int might match the return type of a gcc2
@@ -7873,7 +7867,7 @@ int main() {
 gettext()
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7877: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:7871: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var=yes"
 else
@@ -7912,7 +7906,7 @@ EOF
 	      # Extract the first word of "msgfmt", so it can be a program name with args.
 set dummy msgfmt; ac_word=$2
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_word""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7916: checking for $ac_word" >&5
+echo "configure:7910: checking for $ac_word" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_path_MSGFMT'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
@@ -7946,12 +7940,12 @@ fi
 		for ac_func in dcgettext
 do
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_func""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7950: checking for $ac_func" >&5
+echo "configure:7944: checking for $ac_func" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7955 "configure"
+#line 7949 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char $ac_func(); below.  */
@@ -7974,7 +7968,7 @@ $ac_func();

 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7978: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:7972: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then

   eval "ac_cv_func_$ac_func=yes"
 else

 		# Extract the first word of "gmsgfmt", so it can be a program name with args.
 set dummy gmsgfmt; ac_word=$2
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_word""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:8005: checking for $ac_word" >&5
+echo "configure:7999: checking for $ac_word" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_path_GMSGFMT'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
@@ -8037,7 +8031,7 @@ fi
 		# Extract the first word of "xgettext", so it can be a program name with args.
 set dummy xgettext; ac_word=$2
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_word""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:8041: checking for $ac_word" >&5
+echo "configure:8035: checking for $ac_word" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_path_XGETTEXT'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
@@ -8069,15 +8063,15 @@ else
 fi
 
 		cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 8073 "configure"
+#line 8067 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 int main() {
 extern int _nl_msg_cat_cntr;
 			       return _nl_msg_cat_cntr
